84001.name: The Flintstones: Surprise at Dinosaur Peak
84001.description:
The Flintstones: Surprise at Dinosaur Peak is a video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System and is the second licensed game based on the 1960s Flintstones television series. The game, like the original The Flintstones: The Rescue of Dino & Hoppy, was created and published by Taito. This game was never released in Japan unlike its prequel. It was released only to Blockbuster Video in August 1994. In this game, the player can play as both Fred and Barney, and they both have different attacks and abilities; in the original, the only playable character is Fred. It is known to be the second rarest commercially-released licensed title for the NES (behind Stadium Events) and copies on eBay rarely go below $150 USD.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Flintstones: Surprise at Dinosaur Peak," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84002.name: Sverige-spelet
84002.description:
From the rules:

A family game with both difficult and easy questions about swedish geography, history, culture and nature.

Sverige-spelet is both exciting and educational. Start with dealing out city-cards. Then the players must travel to those cities on the cards they've been dealt. It's important to have a cunning travelplan - and also to be lucky and knowledgable about Sweden - to win the game.

84003.name: Godzilla: Monster of Monsters
84003.description:
Godzilla: Monster of Monsters is a Nintendo Entertainment System video game released in the US in 1989 by Toho Co., Ltd.

Gameplay

The game features two playable characters, Godzilla and Mothra. The player uses both monsters in turn by selecting the desired character on a virtual gameboard, representative of the planet it is on, and moving it like a chess piece. Each space is a hexagon that represents playable, side-scrolling levels.

Each board contains several monsters from the Godzilla series such as Ghidorah, Moguera, and Mechagodzilla, and the objective is to clear each board of enemy monsters before advancing to the next board. Battles are fought when the player moves Godzilla or Mothra adjacent to an enemy monster, and are reminiscent of a versus fighting game. If the player moves to a space that is not adjacent to an enemy monster, the player instead plays a small side-scrolling level.

Source: Wikipedia, "Godzilla: Monster of Monsters", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84004.name: Godzilla 2: War of the Monsters
84004.description:
Godzilla 2: War of the Monsters is a video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System. The player controls military forces trying to prevent Godzilla and other giant monsters from destroying cities. Mothra, Oodako, Hedorah, and Baragon along with King Ghidorah are added to the line up, and are joined by Rodan. This game, released in place of an earlier announced game meant to star Rodan, was received poorly by audiences, due in part to a lack of a genuine plot, and due to the game having an extremely complex style of combat, which was difficult for many players to understand. It was the third Godzilla game for a Nintendo system to be released in North America, after Godzilla: Monster of Monsters for the Nintendo Entertainment System, and Godzilla for Nintendo Game Boy. It would be followed by Super Godzilla for the Super Nintendo Entertainment System in 1993.

Source: Wikipedia, "Godzilla 2: War of the Monsters", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84005.description:
In Lines of Fire you must protect your castle by sending Goblins, Swordsmen, Knights, Orcs, and Dragons into battle.

You will strategically form an army using vertical and horizontal lines of offense and defense. When battle starts, the more powerful unit will defeat the other. The first to reach, and destroy their opponents castle will win the game!

The gameplay is simple. Each player has a castle and a 20-sided die. The die is used as a counter to represent the amount of damage the castle can take before it's destroyed. In order to protect the castle, each player will draw cards. Players will draw creatures with powers of 1 through 5. The higher the number, the more powerful the creature. The creatures are strategically placed in lines using one of 4 horizontal positions in front of the castle. If at any point an "Attack" card is played, the front line of each players army will attack each other in a head to head battle. The creature with higher power will destroy the other. Unused power will be applied to the creature behind the defeated creature. If a player is eventually able to successfully deal damage to another player's castle, the castle takes damage. If a castle is brought to zero, that owner of that castle loses and the game is over.
84005.name: Lines of Fire

84006.name: Dino Dini's Soccer
84006.description:
From the back of the box:

DINO DINI SCORES ANOTHER GOAL!! From the makers of KICK OFF - the best-selling series of football games - comes DINO DINI'S SOCCER, a game so packed full of features, and advanced gameplay, you'll still be at it when France kick off the next World Cup!

Compatible with Sega's 4-player adapter for play with up to 24 friends
Icon-driven menu system
3 different pitch views
Choice of arcade, league, friendly or World Cup modes

84007.name: Doom Troopers: Mutant Chronicles
84007.description:
From the back of the box:

You want the rush from taking on an army of mutated warriors single-handed? Then you may have what it takes to make it as a Doomtrooper!!! Take on worlds infested with the mutated hordes of Dark Legion mutants and teach them the true meaning of fear!
Join Mitch Hunter and Max Steiner as they take on the galaxy-blazing a trail of smoldering Dark Legion Forces in their onslaught to rid the human outposts of the deadly alien threat. Suit up as a Doomtrooper and get ready for the most action-packed combat you've ever seen! The world is counting on you - don't pass this one up!

Plenty of damage waiting to be done as you arm yourself with the latest in rapid-fire, cyber-punk weaponry!
Detailed battle sequences complete with brutal death scenes as the wounded Dark Legion forces sustain massive hits!
Eight incredible levels of interplanetary mayhem with tons of secret areas in this fast-paced action an adventure shoot-out!
2-Player simultaneous cooperative game play!

84008.name: Friday the 13th (1989/NES)
84008.description:
User Summary

Friday the 13th is a NES game loosely based on the horror film of the same name from Paramount. In this game you play as a group of camp counselors attempting to save the children (and yourselves) of Camp Crystal from Jason Vorhees by killing him.

The game features an in screen map showing the locations of all of the cabins, unfortunately left and right on the game screens do not directly correspond to directions on the map. Periodically Jason will attack a cabin (an alarm will sound) and and the gamer has a time limit to get a counselor there (you can switch between counselor's freely if they are not being attacked) and fend him off. If you are too late, Jason will start killing children or a counselor.

Besides avoiding/killing random enemies and dealing with Jason encounters (he will attack you at random on almost all game screens) the player will light fireplaces throughout the camp to increase weapon and item drops. Inside of cabins the game switches from its 2D scrolling view to a primitive 3D view. The game takes place over the course of 3 days. Jason becomes more powerful over the course of the game, but certain in game rewards also increase.

When encountering Jason he will run away after being damaged a certain amount unless his health is low in which case it is a battle to the death!

Notes: Jason wears a bright violet track suit. If you lose the game you are treated to the following message:

"You and your friends are dead. GAME OVER"

making this one of the few NoA releases to mention death or dying.

84009.name: Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story (Sega Platforms)
84009.description:
From the back of the box:

Enter the world of Dragon. A place where the martial arts legend Bruce Lee lived for 32 troublesome years. A place where you will encounter a multitude of the smartest and fiercest opponents ever to be seen in a MEGA DRIVE beat 'em up. At your disposal is a devastating array of over 35 different fighting moves. You WILL need them...


Contains 3 different fighting styles: Mantis, Fighter and Nunchuku.
Many secret special moves to discover.
Using a Multi Tap, three human opponents can fight to the finish.

84010.name: Time Stalkers
84010.description:
Taken from the back:

Unravel the tangle of time.

Enter a new dimension, where time portals collide and create sheer chaos. You are Sword, a great hero who can solve its mystery, and return its people to their right place in time.


Giant universe featured in 3D graphics
Six main characters to choose from
Over 30 characters and 73 monsters to interact with!
Great VMU mini-games
Travel through a multitude of time periods

84011.name: Farm Cards
84011.description:
Farm Cards is a fast-paced game where players assume the roles of farmers, try to harvest the most balanced crops they can, and earn the most money at the Farmer’s Market. Each player is in direct competition with the others and tries to sabotage the others’ fields by dumping garbage on their land! Don’t expect a fellow farmer to be kind, his only goal is to win!

This is a print and play game. There are 108 custom cards depicting plots of land with seeds and values; and seeds with values. The game may also be played with 2 standard 52 card decks + 4 jokers.

Players take turns working with the "junked-up land" passed to them by their competitors and attempt to achieve the highest score through two mechanics.
1- A standard point mechanic through plot and seed values (card face-value).
2- A second scale representing pH balance that can either be positive, negative, or balanced (0). This is achieved through the use of card suits (vegetables, fruits, and grains with the custom cards - 8 in total; Spades, Hearts, Clubs, and Diamonds with standard American playing cards - 4 in total).

The game is currently undergoing playtesting and review.

84012.name: Dragon View
84012.description:
From the back of the box:

Warrior! Open your eyes!
This is the future of gaming! Look! Before you leap, this isn't some corny collection of cardboard dungeons and dragons. It's a brilliant new vision of rpg action adventure. With real-time 16 Meg 3D scrolling like you've never seen. Plus an incredible hero's-eye-view of the danger. Through caves of fire and meadows of ice. Against brutal demons and unforeseen evils. All the way to a showdown you'll never forget. Bring your bow, your sword, your magic. And don't blink - or you're doomed!

84013.name: Silver
videogamehonor: 2000 D.I.C.E. Best Music Composition of the Year Nominee
84013.description:
From the back:

Silver, a corrupt and sinister sorcerer, rules the land of Jarrah with an evil fist. He and his henchmen have abducted the village women as part of a pact with the almighty god, Apocalypse.
Now, only one man can put a stop to Silver and his minions - it's you, David, a promising young knight determined to save his beloved.

The right side of vengeance is coming...


Wield your sword! Slash through your opponents in real time combat
Interact with scores of different characters
Recruit allies - each with unique abilities
Travel through hundreds of of beautiful but dangerous locations
Marvel at vivid special effects, powerful magical spells, and mighty weaponry that you will acquire on your journey

84014.name: Flag to Flag: Cart
84014.description:
From the back:

START YOUR ENGINES!
The CART Championship is up for grabs in the fastest open wheel racing circuit in the world.

19 true-to-life CART circuits
including road, oval and street courses

27 authentic CART drivers
from 18 actual teams

Fully customizable cars
Detailed pit crew action

84015.name: Dragon Valor
84015.description:
From the back:

Defend Your Family, Defend Your Home, But First You Must Defend Yourself

You are the first dragon slayer, a fearless hero who must combat the most horrific of enemies. Vanquish evil, marry the heroine, and continue your heroic legacy with each new generation. Search for swords, magic and relics to aid in your war against the mightiest of dragons. You must battle to prove your worth, your might, your Dragon Valor.

84016.name: Harvey Headbanger
84016.description:
User Review:

Two fat guys are fighting against each other in a cocktail bar by bumping into each other and trying to color more parts of the bar than their opponent.

84017.description:
From the publisher: Football Leader is a simulation of real soccer. 22 players in a board that serves as field. The players (112 pieces in 8 full teams, and all different) have characteristics that allow different actions: pass, goal kick, movement... Each player, in turn, use cards to complete the actions with one or two of his pieces.

Although having random elements like cards to use actions, and dice to determine the success of the actions, it has interesting tactic and strategic characteristics, and moreover, it lets you enjoy the same feelings as a real soccer match!



Football Leader es un juego de simulación de fútbol real. 22 fichas de jugadores en un tablero que hace las veces de campo. Los jugadores (112 fichas en 8 equipos completos y todos diferentes) tienen características que coinciden con las acciones posibles: pase, tiro a puerta, movimiento, etc. Los jugadores por turnos emplean cartas para llevar a cabo dichas acciones con una o dos de sus fichas.Aunque tiene elementos de azar pues se emplean cartas para ejecutar acciones y dados para determinar su resultado, presenta características tanto tácticas como estratégicas muy interesantes y, lo que es más importante, ¡captura la sensación que transmite un encuentro de verdad!
84017.name: Football Leader

84018.name: Chiller (CPC/C64/MSX/ZX)
84018.description:
User Review:

This is a classic platformer in which you have to collect all the items on the screen in order to advance to the next screen. The theme is horror so the screens you visit include a graveyard, a dark forest and (oddly enough) a cinema.
All in all the game is one of the more difficult games that were released back then.

84019.name: Instant GM II: On Your Mark, Get Set, GM!
84019.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Instant GM has reached into his bag of tricks to produce a new volume. Instant GM II: On Your Mark, Get Set, GM! contains 50% more information than the first Instant GM to help you when your players suddenly take a left turn off of the planned adventure.

Instant GM II adds a new volume to the popular Stock Character. In addition to standard NPC it includes some more unusual, but no less important characters like horses, and the Nutcase. It also includes some mystical NPCs such as Angels, Androids, and Ghosts incase your party of brave adventurers wanders way off the beaten track.

By Popular demand, the Rakugo (落語) Props are back. This time with three new items commonly found at the gaming table: books, cards, and glasses. This section explains security guards, Victorian gentlemen and pulling yourself up a cliff, without having to bring any extra props to the table.

Instead of expanding on the list of Plot Seeds, developed in the first Instant GM, this volume includes a section of Adventure Hooks for drawing the party into the story. It doesn’t matter how good of an adventure you wrote, if you can’t motivate the players and their characters to participate, nothing is going to happen. This also includes a section of Advanced Adventure Hooks for when you feel you and your group are ready for them.

An Appendix of quick reference tables is designed to help you use these books when you are improvising.

Finally there is a section of “Tips, Tricks and Rants.” This is advice which doesn’t fit neatly in any single category, but will if you follow these suggestions, you will have to improvise less, and will be better equipped when you do.

84020.name: Blokus
videogamehonor: 2014 CVA Best Social/Casual Game of the Year Nominee
84020.description:
The new award-winning hit board game arrives on the App Store! Play with your friends in local or online Multiplayer mode in one of the 4 game variations! Rules are simple! The winning strategy: Block your opponents so they cannot add any more blocks on the board! Blokus™ is a strategy game that will captivate you and get into your mind.

Source: The Game Website.

84021.name: Bookworm
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Advance edition
84021.description:
Have an appetite for words? Then join Lex the Bookworm in the hit word-puzzle game created by PopCap, makers of the best casual games this side of Jupiter! Link letter tiles left, right, up and down to build words to keep Lex sated and smiling. The bigger the word, the better the bonus. But watch out for burning letters — they could spell disaster for you and Lex!

If you need a quick word break, link letters fast in Action mode. If laid-back wordplay is more your style, go with Classic. No matter which mode you like best, you’ll relax and tune up your brain every time you play!

Source: The Game Website.

84022.name: Button Men
84022.description:
Button Men is a quick-playing dice game for one or two players. You can play against another live player, or you can fight against the built-in AI.

Each Button Man has a unique mix of dice, including at least one die of variable size, called a “swing die.” For example, Avis is 4 4 10 12 X. Her “X” can be any size between 4 and 20.

Players start by rolling all of their dice, and the single lowest number goes first. After that, players take turns capturing each other’s dice using Power and Skill attacks.

Each die is worth its size in points (for example, a d12 is worth 12 points). Dice that you keep are worth half their size (for example, your d12 is worth 6 to you). The goal is to score more points than your opponent by capturing, or keeping, more points.

The loser of each round can change his or her swing die, and the first player to win three rounds wins the match. It takes a great deal of strategy as well as good luck to win a game of Button Men.

Button Men won the Origins Award Best Abstract Board Game of 1999, and the paper version spawned dozens of expansions with hundreds of different characters. This edition includes 24 characters and special rules for Shadow Dice and Poison Dice, with expansions soon to come.

Source: The Game Website.

84023.name: Reiner Knizia's Knights of Charlemagne
84023.description:
Welcome to Knights of Charlemagne; one of Reiner Knizia's classic board games now available for the iPhone and iPod touch!

The rules are simple; turn by turn you must choose to deploy your Knights to one of ten Estates on the board. But not all Estates are worth the same! Can you make the right moves and lead your Knights to victory?

FEATURES:


A cunning AI to play against -- 3 difficulty levels including King Charlemagne himself!



Challenge a human opponent in 2 player mode.



In-game help for beginning players (turn on/off in rules section).


Source: The Game Website.

84024.name: The Alchemist's Workshop
84024.description:
From publisher blurb:

Players who find themselves trapped within this chamber must search the pools that lie within for the four keys needed to unlock its door. The only problem is, some of the pools aren't so cooperative?

Sample:

Invisible Pool
This seemingly empty pool is filled with a failed invisibility potion. The liquid itself has turned invisible. Anything touching the pool will feel wet but look dry and, of course, still be visible. A copper key sits at the bottom of this pool. Anyone reaching for the key will be in for quite a surprise as soon as they come into contact with the invisible liquid. A potion bottle filled with this liquid will appear to be empty, even though it will make a sloshing noise when shook and gurgle when poured.

A line of unique and challenging chambers, designed to be dropped into an already existing adventure; Add-A-Rooms are quick and easy ways to add a little something extra to your game. Each Add-A-Room features elements that can be re-used in other adventures, such as magic pools, fake treasures, or ingenious traps.

The Add-A-Room line is part of System 20, a design your own supplement system created by Creation's Edge Games.

84025.name: The False Treasure Room
84025.description:
From publisher blurb:

While exploring a dungeon, the players stumble across a secret door leading into a room filled with treasure. The group has hit the jackpot, or have they? Nothing is quite what it seems, as treasure after treasure causes trouble after trouble...

Sample:

Boots of Soggy Walking
Appearing to be a well crafted pair of boots of water walking the effects of these cursed boots are quickly discernable once placed upon the wearer's feet. The boots will immediately start to grow damp, to the point of becoming completely soaked in one round. Walking results in the player making loud 'squooshing' sounds and leaving behind a trail of wet footprints. Acts such as moving silently and running are impossible. Extended wear of the boots may result in fungal growth and other adverse effects associated with prolonged contact with water. A remove curse preformed by a caster at 6th level or higher will cancel out the effects of the curse long enough for the boots to be removed.

A line of unique and challenging chambers, designed to be dropped into an already existing adventure; Add-A-Rooms are quick and easy ways to add a little something extra to your game. Each Add-A-Room features elements that can be re-used in other adventures, such as magic pools, fake treasures, or ingenious traps.

84026.name: Hall of Mirrors
84026.description:
From publisher blurb:

While adventuring though a dungeon, the players find what appears to be a small set of closed black curtains mounted upon a wall. Drawing the curtains aside the players find a mirror which promptly sucks them through to its other side. There the players find a maze like hall of magical mirrors that they must carefully navigate to find their way to freedom.

Sample:

Thief's Mirror
Characters peering into this mirror will spy a black-cloaked figure seemingly sneaking around behind their reflection. This mirror will steal one item at random from anyone passing through it. The item is either lost forever or turns up later among the treasure found in another room within the complex, possibly one set up for the sole purpose of storing the stolen objects.

A line of unique and challenging chambers, designed to be dropped into an already existing adventure; Add-A-Rooms are quick and easy ways to add a little something extra to your game. Each Add-A-Room features elements that can be re-used in other adventures, such as magic pools, fake treasures, or ingenious traps.

84027.name: Bonus Potions
84027.description:
From publisher blurb:

Here at Creation's Edge Games the ideas keep on coming, even long after the projects that they were intended for are finished. After generating the 150 new magic potions that make up Buck-A-Batch: Magic Potions I, II, and III we discovered we still had some leftover. As a result we've put together Buck-A-Batch: Bonus Potions available absolutely free as a download through RPG Now. This document features 25 new magic potions for use with d20 fantasy settings.

84028.name: CrossRoads at Darklion Pass
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Six of The Gaming Gang
84028.description:
CrossRoads is a competitive RPG board game. The game can be played with a light conquest approach or a very strategic competition between players. Repeatable play is very enjoyable and different each time.

Game Play: Each player will play with a hand of cards with each card having three potential uses during the game. Managing your cards requires strategy, planning, resource consideration, sacrifice, and making the right card selection to replenish your hand.

Players can choose to discard their cards to travel the game board and earn experience. They can use their cards to put together combination attacks against creatures in a quest to earn experience. The third option is to use cards to heal themselves when life gets too low. The game play is dynamic and competitive with other player disrupting plans and having plans of their own. You will need to manage your cards and maneuver your opponents to win the game.

Goal: The goal of each player is the have the highest experience total at the end of the game. Experience is earned by using cards to either travel over the players color on the game board or by using them to damage a creature within a quest.

Box: Wealth beyond belief is promised to the bravest and most acclaimed adventurer who can purge Dark Lion Pass of its frightful dwellers. However, everyone knows that the pass cannot be cleared by a lone adventurer.

You join a group of adventurers that agree to work together to clear the menace from Dark Lion Pass and share the treasures and glory that come from accomplishing such a grand feat. The agreement is a loose alliance… each adventurer seems to be attempting to steal the glory and hoard the best treasures.
Are they attempting to be the bravest adventurer and keep all of the reward for themselves?

During the adventure you will try to gain as much glory as you can by stealing the treasure and doing the most damage to the creatures that lurk in the passes. You may also manipulate the path that your party takes to enhance your glory even further in Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass.

Can you manage all of this with the limited resources at your disposal? Only time and an adventure of a lifetime will tell. Welcome to Crossroads at Dark Lion Pass!

84029.name: Sgt. Preston Gets His Man
84029.description:
From eBay listing (Michelle Murray, used with permission):

This is a cardboard board game cut off of a cereal box. It's called "Sgt. Preston Gets His Man" and comes with the playing field, a spinner, 4 little pawns and instructions. To make the spinner work, you would put a straight pin through the center and twirl it--there should be a tiny cardboard pointer but that part is missing [in the photos]. The cardboard playing board is about 6" x 6", the spinner is 1 3/4" across, and each little pawn is 1/2" x 1/2". There is no date but it's probably 1950s.

84030.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms VIII
84030.description:
From the back of the package:

The most dramatic game in the series yet!

Special officer skills, allied schemes, and War Council directives intertwine in a rich tapestry of intrigue.

> over 600 commanders plus 100 additional officers that you create. Special Rulers, Warlords, Viceroys, Free Officers and Bands.

> Play up to 8 characters at once.

> From allies to archrivals, from brothers to bitter enemies, explore the bonds that exist among warriors. Forge new relationships with new commands such as "Marriage" and "Sworn Brother".

> 15 new tactical skills, including "Fire Arrow", "Ambush", and "Magic".

> Over 50 scenarios including one entirely fictional story featuring every officer in the game.

> Begin the game at any year - from the start of the Yellow Turban Rebellion to the death of Zhuge Liang.

> 81 item classes, nearly 100 types of events, and over 40 different endings.

84031.name: Kingsburg: Serving the Crown
84031.description:
The first official Kingsburg App is now available from the App Store. Designed by iNigma and built by JustFunnyGames, Kingsburg Serving the Crown is the iPhone and iPod Touch port of the award-winning board game, published on 2007 by Stratelibri. The app will ask you to oversee a province, at the very edge of King Tritus' realm. With the help of the King’s trusted advisors, you will obtain the resources to construct buildings and train your army.

The app has been specifically crafted for the iPhone and iPod touch with an intuitive and elegant gameplay, which entirely fits the boardgame experience, powered by the features of the device.

Key features of the Kingsburg Serving the Crown include:
- Solo mode: play against your iPhone
- Pass and Play mode: compete with your friends in challenges for up to 5 players!
- Available languages: English and Italian
- Official port of the board game Kingsburg, featuring the original artwork
- Complete game rulebook and in-game hints
- Chance to unlock new game modes
- Original sound track performed by Simone Cicconi
- App compatible with IOS 4 and iPad

Source: The Game Website.

84032.name: R.U.S.E.
videogamehonor: 2009 Game Critics Best Strategy Game of the Year Nominee
84032.description:
R.U.S.E. is a real-time strategy video game developed by Eugen Systems and published by Ubisoft which was released for Microsoft Windows, PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 in September 2010. R.U.S.E. is a strategy game with systems that focus on information warfare and are intended to be superior over brute force. Players can use a series of ruses and decoys to trick their enemies and change the outcome of battles.

Source: Wikipedia, "R.U.S.E.," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84033.name: Godzilla vs. Earth Defense Force
84033.description:
It is card game of the Godzilla movie.
The player defends place card allocated as a commander of the earth defense force.
The player drops out when all place cards are destroyed. The player that remains to the last minute wins.

Turn sequence:
1.Draw cards
2.Play cards
3.Attack evil monsters

Component:
100 cards
1 rule

84034.name: Magic Armor I
84034.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outfit your characters with armor that does more than just add points to their armor class. Here are just a few of the items we pulled out of our magic armory: Missileguard Shield, Prismatic Armor, Shield of the Labyrinth, and Dire Bear Hide.

84035.name: Magic Armor II
84035.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outfit your characters with armor that does more than just add points to their armor class. Here are just a few of the items we pulled out of our magic armory this time: Armor of the Crypts, Touchback Armor, Swarm Shield, and Armor of Transformation.

84036.name: Magic Armor III
84036.description:
From publisher blurb:

We went back into our armory and came out with fifty new items that get a little proactive in their protection: Armor of Displacement, Bubble Shield, Helm of the Beholder, and Shield of Curses to name a few.

84037.description:
A mini-game from the oldschool French magazine Casus Belli (Issue 18 - Dec 1983). In the game, adventurers must seduce the Queen of the Kingdom of Passion and eliminate all others courtiers while controlling military patrols. The game is a mix between roleplaying games and boardgame as each player defines the seduction and discretion score for his character. Several magic items may be found to help him in his mission.
The game can be played by 2 to 4 players.
The game has only 10 counters : 4 characters and 6 patrols.
It needs 2 d6 dices to play.
The games ends when a character has managed to sit on the throne besides the queen and all other players are captured, or it ends when all the characters are captured and remain in the depths of the dungeon.
84037.name: Pour l'amour d'une reine

84038.name: Magic Items I
84038.description:
From publisher blurb:

50 new magic items for use with D20 rules. Candle of Darkness? Screaming Coin? Monster Cube? From "one use" to fun use you'll find it all here.

84039.name: Premier Manager
84039.description:
From the back of the package:

For the first time in a video game, you can discuss in real time with club directors, commercial managers, player agents and journalists. Learn from their expressions to achieve the best possible deal.

> Experience the pressure of real life management. Schedule time to prioritize events and day to day duties such as training sessions, press conferences, contract negotiations and much more.

> Pick a team from 1 of 5 European leagues and take control. Tactics, transfers, team management, finances, club development and much much more are now in your hands.

> Sport never stops on the (in-game) 24 hour Eurosport news TV channel that displays everything from tables and fixtures, to rules and stock market flotations.

84040.name: Magic Items II
84040.description:
From publisher blurb:

50 new magic items for use with D20 rules. Chalk of Explosive Runes? Freeze-form Collar? Magician's Bookmark? From "one use" to fun use you'll find it all here.

84041.name: Magic Items III
84041.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new addition to our best selling Buck-A-Batch line, Magic Items III contains FIFTY new items for use in your d20 fantasy adventures!

Sample:

Bag of Skulls
This small black cloth bag holds 2d6 miniature stone skulls. If the owner of this bag draws forth one of these skulls and tosses it at their feet the skull will transform into a medium-size skeleton. This skeleton will serve the owner of the bag until it is destroyed. The owner can choose to use more than 1 skull at a time however they may only control a number of skeleton equal to half their current experience level. The bag crumbles to dust once the last skull has been used.

84042.name: Dr. Mario & Puzzle League
84042.description:
Dr. Mario & Puzzle League (entitled Dr. Mario & Panel de Pon (Dr.MARIO&パネルでポン) in Japan) is a 2-in-1 game released for the Game Boy Advance in 2005. It is a combination of Dr. Mario and Panel de Pon.

Source: Wikipedia, "Dr. Mario & Puzzle League," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84043.name: Magic Masks I
84043.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masks have captivated us for centuries as a medium for mystic transformation, divine communication, and spiritual ritual. Here are some masks that will captivate your foes while you and the rest of your party whups up on them?

Sample:

Alignment Mask (Crusader)
This mask bestows certain spell like abilities upon its wearer, provided that they are of lawful good alignment. The wearer becomes protected as though affected by a continuous protection from evil spell for as long as the mask is worn. The wearer can also use the mask to cast the order's wrath spell three times per day. Lastly, as a one-time effect, the wearer can remove the mask and break it in half. Doing so destroys the mask, releasing the arcane energies trapped within. These energies take the form of a summon monster V spell, calling forth a creature to protect the mask's former owner. The creature summoned must be of lawful good, lawful neutral, or neutral good alignment.

84044.name: Magic Masks II
84044.description:
From publisher blurb:

Masks have enthralled us for centuries as a medium for mystic transformation, divine communication, and spiritual ritual. Here are 50 more masks that will enthrall your foes while the rest of your party whups up on them?

Sample:

Animal Mask (bear)
Three times per day the wearer of this mask can use it to transform into a bear. This spell functions similar to a polymorph self spell (as described in the Dungeons and Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition) as though cast by an 18th level wizard. The wearer can also talk to bears as though they were under the effect of a permanent speak with animals spell for as long as the mask is worn. The mask merges with the bear form and becomes part of the wearer while transformed.

84045.name: Magic Masks III
84045.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creations Edge Games brings you fifty new masks that do more than just hide your face. These will make your enemies hide theirs as well: Acid-spit Mask, Gaze Block Mask, Mask of Blinding, Mask of the Minotaur and the Spell-steal Mask to name a few.

84046.name: Magic Potions I
84046.description:
From publisher blurb:

The alchemists at Creation's Edge Games have whipped up 50 new potions for your d20 fantasy campaigns.

Sample:

Selective Non-detection (animals)
This potion makes the imbiber undetectable to animals. Creatures of this type cannot perceive the user of the potion as they normally would. If the animal has reason to believe that an undetectable creature is present they can still attempt to attack them suffering all the applicable penalties for attempting to attack an 'invisible' target. If the undetectable creature takes action against an animal, such as physically attacking or casting a spell at, the potion's effect becomes temporarily disrupted, making the creature fully detectible by the animal the following round. If the creature takes no action against the animal for the round that they are visible to it the potion will kick in once again the round after that rendering the creature effectively 'invisible' once again. The effects of this potion last for 1d4 hours.

84047.name: Magic Potions II
84047.description:
From publisher blurb:

The alchemists at Creation's Edge Games have whipped up another 50 potions for your d20 fantasy campaigns.

Sample:

Chaotic Healing
Characters of chaotic alignment favor this potion, for how well it functions is left purely to chance. Once the potion has been imbibed roll 1d4. A result of 1 indicates that the drinker has been healed for 1 point. A result of 2 indicates that the potion functions as a cure light wounds potion. A result of 3 indicates that the potion functions as a cure moderate wounds potion. A result of 4 indicates that the potion functions as a cure serious wounds potion. A chaotically aligned creature will be healed for an additional 1d4 points.

84048.name: Magic Potions III
84048.description:
From publisher blurb:

The alchemists at Creation's Edge Games have whipped up another 50 potions for your d20 fantasy campaigns.

Sample:

Hasting Cloud
This potion has a dual use. Drinking it causes the imbiber to become hasted as though they were the target of a haste spell (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition) cast at 8th level. Alternatively the owner can choose to shatter it upon the ground. This shattering releases the potion's magic in the form of a 20' billowing cloud. All creatures within this cloud become hasted as though they were targeted by a mass haste spell (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition) cast at 12th level. This cloud will effect up to 8 creatures and will dissipate as quickly as it formed.

84049.name: Magic Rings I
84049.description:
From publisher blurb:

For whatever reason, magic rings have become even more popular with players as of late (hmm). Don't let them down. Give them a new ring every game.

Magic Rings I features 50 new magic rings for use with D20 fantasy settings.

Sample:

Demon Ring
This cursed ring is carved to resemble a demonic vestige. Those brave enough to wearer it, by sticking their finger within its fanged and gaping maw, will find it impossible to remove without the assistance of a remove curse spell. The wearer will suffer no ill effects until an hour has passed. At this point the ring will animate and the fangs will plunge into the wearer's finger dealing a painful point of damage to them and permanently drain 1 point of constitution. For each night the ring is worn it will drain another point of constitution. Once the ring begins 'feeding' its wearer gains two abilities. The wearer can perform a Draining Touch once per day. By succeeding at a melee touch attack the wearer can drain 1d4 hit points from a target as well as 1 point of constitution. The wearer is then healed for as many hit points as drained and a point of ring drained constitution is restored to them. The wearer of the ring may also cast a ray of enfeeblement once per day (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition). The ray functions at the wearer's level and its point of origin is the eyes of the demon on the ring.

84050.name: Magic Rings II
84050.description:
From publisher blurb:

For whatever reason, magic rings have become even more popular with players as of late (hmm). Don't let them down. Give them a new ring every game.

Magic Rings I features 50 new magic rings for use with D20 fantasy settings.

Sample:

Dead Ringer Ring
This ring consists of two interlocking bands. In order to use it the bands can be split apart to form two rings. If one ring is placed upon the finger of a corpse and the other upon the finger of a living being, the living being will appear exactly as the corpse did in real life. This ring affects the physical appearance only and does not modify the wearer's clothes, abilities, speech, mannerism, memories, etc. The wearer must be of a race similar to the size and build of the deceased otherwise the ring will not function. This illusion will last for one hour after which the two rings must be touched to one another in order to renew the disguise. This illusion vanishes the moment either of the rings are removed.

84051.name: Magic Rings III
84051.description:
From publisher blurb:

For whatever reason, magic rings have become even more popular with players as of late (hmm). Don't let them down. Give them a new ring every game.

Magic Rings I features 50 new magic rings for use with D20 fantasy settings.

Sample:

Ring of Allegiance (Good)
This ring can only be worn by a creature of good alignment. This ring functions as a ring of protection +2 with a couple of extra bonuses. The wearer becomes protected as though under the effects of a permanent protection from evil spell (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons? Player's Handbook, Third Edition). In addition to this the ring keeps track of evil aligned creatures slain by the wearer. Once the wearer has dealt the killing stroke to a total of 20 evil aligned creatures the ring will bestow a one-time bonus of 3000 experience points. This ring will bestow 1d4 negative levels upon any non-good creature that attempts to wear it.

84052.name: No More Room In Hell
84052.description:
Stand alone miniatures rules set for survival modern horror gaming. 28mm scale (though can really be used for any scale). Book contains several scenarios providing different challenges for the zombie survival genre.

From the back of the book:

No More Room In Hell - Surviving the Zombie Apocalypse allows you to create a group of characters amidst the end of the living world...and the start of the living-dead world. Who will survive? Who will feed the Zeds? It's up to you to select the skills, the traits and the gear that you think that your survivors will need to face the rising zombie tide.

Featuring a campaign system, stand-alone games, random scenario, and quick-play random character generation, anything goes. You'll need to fight the dead and the living as you struggle to gather enough food, ammunition and food for your band.

videogame: The Best of Windows Entertainment Pack
84053.name: FreeCell
videogamecompilation: The Best of Windows Entertainment Pack
84053.description:
User Summary

A computer version of the card game FreeCell that is automatically included in Windows. In the game you make sets of cards by stacking in sequence but in opposing colors. You have 4 free spaces to hold troublesome cards until you can use them later.

84054.name: Total Club Manager 2004
84054.description:
From the back of the package:

The game offers you the opportunity to become an every aspect manager of a soccer team. You can choose among an impressive 1200 teams and 18000 players from over 32 leagues/divisions. You can also export your team from Total Club Manager 2004 into FIFA Football 2004, play the fixture, import the result back and continue your managerial duties. These duties include:

> Customizing daily training routines,
> Setting individual team tactics,
> Dealing in an exciting transfer market,
> Managing club finances,
> Developing club facilities

Other features include the option of fast simulation, text simulation or a complete 3D simulation, half-time interviews for improving team moral, player of the month and manager of the month awards and improved 3D graphics.

84055.name: Let's Make a Soccer Team!
84055.description:
From the back of the package

You are the creator and the chairman of a soccer club. You can take on leagues in England, Italy, Spain, Holland, Germany, France and Ireland as well as Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland and Monaco.

Every aspect on and off the pitch is under your control. Once you master the staff morale, the training, tactics and transfers, you have still to develop your facilities and stadium, keep the sponsors happy and create and sell merchandise.

The game has serious RPG elements with an evolving story and characters along with the regular management aspects.

84056.name: Civil War Generals II
84056.description:
Civil War Generals II is a computer game published by Sierra Entertainment in 1997. It simulates on a tactical level individual battles of the American Civil War and allows one to play as either the North or South in a number of different campaigns. It links the battles together by making the losses in one battle reflect on the forces available in the next. Also, the capture of supplies during one battle allows one to purchase weapons upgrades before the next. It is the sequel to Robert E. Lee: Civil War General.

Source: Wikipedia, "Civil War Generals II," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84057.name: Starship Marine
84057.description:
Starship Marines is an Starcraft boarding game done by Jim Wallman for minimum two players, with no limit in players. The game itself is a print and play type, and available for free download.

From the Introduction in the basic rules:
Starship Marine is a set of science fiction wargame rules, designed for use with toy soldiers. The basic idea is that there is a battle to control and capture a starship by a boarding party moving down the corridors and rooms of the ship. One side controls the attackers, who are mostly composed of the eponymous 'Starship Marines', and the defenders, usually less well armed crewmen, with perhaps a smattering of Marines to stiffen the defense. The deck plans can either be drawn out or built in 3D, depending on your preferences and time available. The scale of toy soldier is 25mm or 1/72, and any make of figures can be used [...]

The minimum you need are a few toy soldiers, some dice, a large sheet of paper with a deck plan on it, and the rules. A typical small game takes about a hour or so (longer if you like arguing about rules). The largest game we know of, to date, involved some 60 people, hundreds of toy soldiers, and many very very big sheets of paper.[...]

84058.name: Dance Dance Revolution Ultramix
videogameversion: North American Xbox (Platinum Family Hits) edition
84058.description:
Dance Dance Revolution ULTRAMIX, or DDR Ultramix, is the sixth home version of Dance Dance Revolution to be released in the United States, and the first DDR game to be released on the Microsoft Xbox video game console. It was released by Konami exclusively in North America on November 19, 2003, being the first ever DDR game exclusively for the American audience. A European version called Dancing Stage Unleashed was released shortly after. It comes with 51 songs, nine of which are hidden and unlockable. 15 of those songs were new to Dance Dance Revolution.

Source: Wikipedia, "[ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dance_Dance_Revolution_Ultramix Dance Dance Revolution Ultramix]", available under the [ http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/ CC-BY-SA License].

84059.name: Magic Weapons I
84059.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever hear of a golem shuriken? How about a whip-wall whip? Sounds kind of nasty doesn't it? We put the arms back in harms with 50 new magic weapons for use with D20 rules.

Sample:

Gauntlet, Sigil
By closing their hand and concentrating for one round, the wearer of a Sigil Gauntlet can cause a symbol to form upon the palm of this gauntlet. In combat, this symbol can then be displayed to a creature or group of creatures and its mystic energies released. The effect is the same as that of a symbol spell (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, third edition) as though it were cast by an 15th level cleric. The symbol disappears after its energy has been released. The gauntlet can only form each type of symbol once and will crumble to dust after the last symbol is used.

84060.name: Magic Weapons II
84060.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever hear of a golem shuriken? How about a whip-wall whip? Sounds kind of nasty doesn't it? We put the arms back in harms with 50 new magic weapons for use with D20 rules.

Sample:

Scorpion Spear
This shortspear features a long length of chain, which dangles freely from its tail end. The chain is fixed to a small metal ball with a sharp spike jutting out from it. The spear functions as a normal spear until a critical hit is made, at which point the chain will animate and send the spike ball arcing up over the user's head and into the head or back of the opponent. This extra attack hits automatically and does an additional 2d4 points of damage.

84061.name: Magic Weapons III
84061.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take a look at our brand new stock of 50 magic weapons, fresh out of the forge and ready for adventure. Enjoy!

Sample:

Crossbow of Turning
This +1 hand crossbow functions as a +3 hand crossbow against undead. In addition to this, by holding the crossbow upright, in a cross-like fashion, the wielder can turn undead as though they were a cleric of the same level. Clerics gain a +3 bonus to their charisma modifier when attempting to turn undead while within 20ft of a crossbow of turning.

84062.name: Magic Wear I
84062.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your character's just like everyone else. They put their gloves on one hand at a time. The only difference is that their gloves let them shoot flaming arrows from their fingertips. 50 new magic items that let adventurers dress for success.

Sample:

Hat of Summoning (monster)
Twice per day, the owner of this hat can remove it, reach inside, and draw out creatures to assist them in battle. This ability functions as a summon monster III spell (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition) as though it were cast by a 6th level wizard. The wearer produces a small black egg from the hat which, when thrown before them, cracks and produces a full-sized version of the monster specified. This egg will disintegrate if not thrown in one round. They cannot be stockpiled.

84063.name: Magic Wear II
84063.description:
From publisher blurb:

We go back into our wardrobe to bring you another batch of 50 new items of magic wear for your D20 fantasy campaign setting. From the Two-way Pouch to the Portable Store Backpack you're sure to find the perfect accessory for the adventure at hand.

Sample:

Quiver of the Hornet's Nest
Once per day, the owner of this quiver can use it to cast a magic missile spell (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition). This spell functions as though cast by a 9th level wizard. The spell causes 5 arrows within the quiver to transform into magic missiles. The missiles function exactly as the spell as far as damage, distance, and target choices are concerned. The quiver must contain at least 5 standard non-magic arrows for the spell to work. The missiles fire directly from the quiver.

84064.name: Magic Wear III
84064.description:
From publisher blurb:

We dug into the back of our magic wardrobe and found 50 new articles of apparel for use with d20 fantasy settings. Enjoy!

Sample:

Robe of Elemental Summoning (fire)
The wearer of this robe can cast resist elements (fire) upon themselves three times per day (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition). This spell makes the robe appear as though it were made of fire. The robe is adorned with six images of fire elementals. Once per day the wearer can use the robe to summon a medium size fire elemental. This ability functions similar to a monster summoning V spell (as described in the Dungeons & Dragons Player's Handbook, Third Edition). Each time this spell is used one of the images on the robe will vanish. Once the last image vanishes the robe loses its abilities and becomes worthless. Both spells function as though cast at 10th level.

84065.name: Modern Magic Items I
84065.description:
From publisher blurb:

The first supplement to be offered in our Buck-A-Batch line for D20 Modern contains a total of FIFTY new magic items with a modern slant. Here even the most mundane everyday objects have been touched by magic- from children's toys to music CDs...

Sample:

Foe-b-gone Spray Can
This object was the subject of several late night infomercials before it's inventor mysteriously vanished. Advertised as a new and improved replacement for mace and pepper spray, Foe-b-gone is literally fear in a can. One spray acts in a fashion identical to a fear spell cast at 8th level. The can holds 6 charges.

84066.name: Modern Magic Items II
84066.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second supplement to be offered in our Buck-A-Batch line for D20 Modern contains a total of FIFTY new magic items with a modern slant. Here even the most mundane everyday objects have been touched by magic- from children's toys to music CDs...

Sample:

Wizard's Gum (displacement)
Sold only at select and secret stores throughout the world, wizard's gum has become a popular item among modern day adventurers. In addition to a pleasant fruity taste each stick of wizard's gum holds a spell, triggered by the act of chewing. The chewer of this gum is protected as though they were the target of a displacement spell. This spell lasts for 10 minutes after which the effect vanishes and the gum becomes flat and tasteless. Each pack of wizard's gum contains 7 sticks of gum.

84067.name: Modern Magic Items III
84067.description:
From publisher blurb:

Creation's Edge Games brings you fifty new magic items with a contemporary slant. Here's a collection of commonplace items with not so common abilities:

Anything Bag, Message Balloon, Portable Wall Safe and the Sound Storm Whistle to name a few.

Sample:

Mana Monsters Land Card (lightning fields)
This is a card from a popular collectible card game that somehow has become imbued with mystic powers. The owner of this card is protected to a degree from electricity attacks provided the card remains within 5 feet of them. The owner takes half damage from any such attacks. As a one use function the owner can tear the card in half. This tearing triggers an electricity blast that deals 5d6 points electricity damage to all creatures within 20 feet of the card excluding the owner. The card loses its abilities once it is torn.

84068.name: Deep Fighter
84068.description:
User Summary:

"Deep Fighter" is a relatively unknown game by Criterion Games, who went on to Burnout fame. Taking its gameworld from PC game Subculture, Deep Fighter mixes first person space simulator gameplay (e.g. Starlancer or Colony Wars) with an underwater game setting.

Set on a futuristic Earth where rival companies are competing to control & monopolize the sea floor, the player pilots a submarine aiming to complete a variety of missions for his/her company while fighting other subs, jellyfish & other sealife.

84069.name: Romance of the Three Kingdoms IV: Wall of Fire
84069.description:
From the back of the package:

It is the second Han Dynasty and China is on the verge of collapse. Infighting among the court families and the emergence of powerful warlords dominates the landscape. The struggle for power has brought an era known as the Three Kingdoms, complete with constant warfare among China's most courageous and skillful heroes.

As a ruler during these difficult times, it's up to you to unify a country torn apart by rebellion. Expand your kingdom by building a strong military, or try outsmarting your rivals during negotiations. With exciting new weapons including automatic firing crossbows and catapults, you can engage your opponents out in the open and from behind castle walls. But don't forget, a ruler's strength is also measured by his economic power of his kingdom and the happiness of its people.

FEATURES

> Discuss war strategy with up to 558 different officers, including 108 inspired by the player's imagination.

> Defeat enemies using powerful new weapons, including automatic firing crossbows, battering rams and catapults.

> Play one of 38 exciting rulers, eight of whom you can create yourself.

> Set enemy units, ships or cities ablaze using o variety of FIRE commands.

> New On-Line manual gives you valuable game information.

> One to eight player excitement.

84071.name: Rex  Nemorensis
84071.description: This print and play game lets the players compete through chip investments in the forms of plants and animals. The eventual winner is the one with the most points in chips at the end of the twelfth round or the one who amasses 20 or more chips and has a human in play at the end of a round. A player must be aware at all times of what his opponents are doing, what cards are in play, how many plants/prey are available and who will be first or last in the turns to come. The gods are fickle and hunting is always uncertain at best, so to be smiled upon by the die of fate is a must.

84073.name: Semper Fi
84073.description:
From the box back:

In Semper Fi, you are a Marine Battalion commander leading an elite fighting force - locating, closing with, and destroying the enemy. Just like the Marines, you'll have to be prepared for any mission, whether it's hostage rescue, humanitarian assistance, or all out war. To aid you in your task, you'll have command of a vast array of infantry and armored vehicles, with forces ranging in size from a single company to a complete battalion. And for the ultimate in combat, you can engage your friends via head-to-head modem, network or internet play.

Features:


3 campaigns and 15 stand-alone scenarios
Full-featured scenario builder and map editor for unlimited gameplay
A huge variety of unit types including infantry, armor, amphibious assault vehicles, helicopters and recon
Realistic modeling of command and control, as well as morale effects on all troops
Online database of equipment and units
Multiplayer options including head-to-head modem, network and Internet play (for two players)

84074.name: Campin' Out
boardgamepublisher: Department of Natural Resources, Michigan Parks & Recreation
84074.description:
Players roll a die to move their piece along the track and answer questions about the Michigan State Park System and nature. The first player to reach the campfire wins.

The game is made of recycled materials and labels are supplied to stick onto bottle tops to create player tokens.

(User Summary)

84075.name: Dynamite Dan II: Dr Blitzen and the Islands of Arcanum
84075.description:
This is the sequel to Dynamite Dan.

"Reviews were positive, with CRASH awarding 93% and Your Sinclair gave 9 out of 10. Reviewers were impressed with the graphical and sound effect improvements over the original game, and the fun gameplay."

Source: Wikipedia, "Dynamite Dan 2", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84076.name: Golden Axe Warrior
84076.description:
Golden Axe Warrior (ゴールデンア ックスウォーリア) is an action-adventure game spin-off of the popular Golden Axe game series. The game was released on the Sega Master System in 1991. The plot of the game followed a young warrior who was trying to avenge the death of his parents by exploring ten labyrinths, collecting nine missing crystals and battling with Death Adder inside the last. All the major characters from Golden Axe — the warrior Ax Battler, the amazon Tyris Flare, and the dwarf Gilius Thunderhead — help the player throughout the game by bestowing him with magic.

Source: Wikipedia, "Golden Axe Warrior", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84078.name: Elfaria
84078.description:
User Summary

Elfaria is a role playing game, in which the hero Pyne must save the world from an evil emperor. The game does not have any money or experience points, instead you gain levels from defeating boss enemies, and items only drop from enemies.

84079.name: Uninvited
84079.description:
Uninvited is a haunted house "point-and-click" adventure video game originally for the Macintosh, released in 1986 by ICOM Simulations. The unnamed hero must find the way through an abandoned house in order to rescue a sibling. The quest involves magic and solving logical puzzles while discovering sinister secrets of the house's former inhabitants.

Source: Wikipedia, "Uninvited (game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84080.name: Shogun
84080.description:
Not to be confused with the text adventure that came out in 1989 this game here is an adventure with graphical interface.

Back of the box

Traverse 128 different screens and try to gain enough (say 20) followers to take over the royal palace. Interact with 40 characters who all have different traits and characteristics. This game is also based on the world bestseller by James Clavell.

84081.name: The Living Airship
84081.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A stolen airship.

A Vallorian fleshcrafter.

A secluded mountain outpost.

Vallorians, a pernicious race of subterranean humanoids, forever seek to invade and subjugate the surface world with their twisted, living weapons. One enterprising enclave absconded with a gnomish airship and moored it deep within the Spellborne Peaks. Led by the ambitious Hegen diHorome, they work to fleshcraft The Zephyr into a sentient aerial dreadnought- a living airship. Can the heroes navigate through the treacherous caverns to defeat diHorome and his allies in time? Or will the Vallorians blight the skies over Questhaven with their monstrous vessel?

The Living Airship An adventure for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game suitable for 4-6 Player Characters of 7th to 10th level.

84082.name: Drawn: The Painted Tower
videogamehonor: 2010 D.I.C.E. Casual Game of the Year Nominee
84082.description:
Drawn: The Painted Tower is an adventure-puzzle casual game developed by Big Fish Studios, and distributed by Big Fish Games. It is the first installment in the Drawn series. The game is available exclusively at Big Fish Games website.

Drawn: The Painted Tower unfolds in a land devoid of all happiness. A young girl named Iris represents the last bastion of hope. Anything she draws comes to life, and her imagination moves her to sketch and paint medieval scenes filled with mythical creatures. With this power at her disposal, there are those who would seek to capture the Iris and harness her magic for their own gains. It was for this reason her family sent her into exile to protect her from harm. However, an evil king has discovered her whereabouts and is bent on her capture.

The player must enter the puzzle-filled hallways of the Painted Tower, locate, and save Iris. Many objects in the game are not what they appear to be and player's must explore each scene to unlock all the locks and puzzles.

Source: Wikipedia, "Drawn: The Painted Tower", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84083.name: Drawn: Dark Flight
84083.description:
Drawn: Dark Flight is an adventure-puzzle casual game developed by Big Fish Studios, and distributed by Big Fish Games. It is the second installment in the Drawn series. The game is available exclusively at Big Fish Games website.

Drawn: Dark Flight begins where the previous game, Drawn: The Painted Tower, finished. Iris has escaped from the Tower, but she still needs help. The player must explore the Kingdom of Stonebriar and help Iris light the three beacons, so that she can become Queen of the kingdom.

Source: Wikipedia, "Drawn: Dark Flight", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84085.name: Jass
84085.description:
«Jass» is the version for iPhone / iPod Touch of the well-known «Chibre» card game. Made in Switzerland, «Jass» will stun you with the charmingly reproduced aspects of our traditional national game.

Source: The Game Website.

84086.name: Critical Hit! Issue 4
84086.description:
Fourth biannual issue of "The Independent Journal of the ASL Hobby"

From the table of contents:
Armored Assault Tactics by Capt. Robert Modarelii III
Rangers Lead the Way by Steven C. Swann
Interview with Brian Martuzas
Stagnation and Innovation by Kurt Martin
Ernie Pyle: The Battle of San Pietro by Ray Tapio
ASL Action in the U.K. and the Midwest by Pete Phillips and Burnie Hegdahl
Roasting Chestnuts by Ted Blek and Alan Freedman

Scenarios:
CH41 Test of Nerves
CH42 Teryaeva Sloboda
CH43 Opening Blow
CH44 Operation Norwind
CH45 Curtain Call
CH46 Zerf Stranglehold
CH47 Steel and Irony
CH48 Double or Nothing!
CH49 High Danger
CH50 Simmons' Rebuff

84087.name: Against the Dead
84087.description:
From the Introduction:

Against the Dead is a role-playing game in the tradition of your favorite zombie movie. Set in a world much like our own, the game pits your character against the unrelenting hordes of ravenous corpses that grow legion as each hour passes. Only the strongest, bravest, and most resourceful individuals have a chance of surviving this threat. Rarer still are those who can take advantage of the rise of the dead and not simply survive, but emerge as a master of the new world in the wake of its cleansing at the hands of the undead.

Against the Dead is a fast paced, action oriented game that can be played either as a one or two session break from other games, or as an epic campaign that follows the fate of the world from the earliest reports of zombies rising to the last days of an apocalypse where the continued existence of life on Earth is in question. To facilitate these different approaches, the game presents the world in three stages of the zombie threat. First is the Emergence Stage, where zombies are few and mysterious. Next is the Ascendance Stage, in which zombies are quickly becoming as common as living folk and all the devices of civilization are being arrayed against them. Finally there is the Apocalypse Stage, where zombies are the norm and humans are scattered and few, faced with the real possibility of extinction.

The world of Against the Dead is described only as it relates to zombies. In all other ways it is the world that you woke up to this morning. Until people started to actually see the dead walk, zombies only existed in movies and comic books. Magic was fictional. Radiation could not infuse recently dead corpses with power. Faith was a personal matter that hadn't manifested a true miracle since ancient times. But something happened...

Against the Dead is not concerned with why the dead have begun to walk the Earth. They simply have. Some zombies are created by infectious disease, spread as the undead are driven to consume human flesh. Others are the result of profane magical or dark religious rites. Still others are created by radiation. Individual Game Masters are welcome to create whatever explanation they like for the rise of the dead. Or perhaps there are many explanations. Regardless, your character must find ways to fight the zombies or join their pile of partially consumed victims... perhaps to rise as one shortly thereafter.

Based on the d20 Modern System Reference Document, Against the Dead presents a streamlined version of the rules that deals exclusively with zombies and ways to fight them. The only material you need to play the game is this book, a set of gaming dice, and a pencil and paper. Miniatures to represent characters and zombies are recommended, but not necessary. A CD or two of panicky ambient music can greatly assist the atmosphere of a game session, as can a soundtrack from any of the hundreds of zombie movies - good and bad - that have been produced over the years.

Presented in a straightforward "crunchy" style that should appeal to experienced gamers and newbies alike, Against the Dead doesn't spend a lot of time with detailed descriptions or dense prose. We've all seen the flicks. We know what a good old fashioned zombie infestation looks like. The dead are out there. Go get 'em.

84088.description:
This is the version of Fauna for the younger ones.

As in Fauna it is all about animals. It is a trivia game where you get a picture of an animal and all players can guess on where the animal is living (six different vegetation zones), how much is the weight (no numbers only comparisons to seven different objects), if it lay eggs and if it eats only plants.

The first player guessing right will get 2 points, the other are only getting 1 point.

So Fauna junior is much easier than Fauna.
84088.name: Fauna junior

84089.name: Shrek Treasure Hunt
84089.description:
From the back of the case:

Shrek and Princess Fiona are planning a picnic but the Three Blind Mice borrowed Shrek's picnic materials and well misplaced them! It is now up to you to help Shrek hunt around the swamp for the missing items!

10 mini-games to complete.

Activities include fishing and tug of war.

Hours of action-packed Shrek fun!

84090.name: High Seas Trader
84090.description:
From the back of the package:

High Seas Trader breaks away from the fleet with its unique first person, YOU ARE THERE 3-D perspective!

Are you ready to take the helm of your own ship as a 17th century horizon slides into view? This completely new look in strategy gaming (no more little ships on flat maps!) puts you right up on deck while you outrun pirates and create trade routes to riches.

Get ready for wealth, danger and conquest in your bid to master the great maritime trading routes. Put ashore in faraway ports to repair the cannonball damage from the brigands you just blew away. And while you are doing R&R in exotic climes, drop into the local tavern for intrigue, supplies and enough rum to keep your crew six sheets to the wind.

This swashbuckling strategy game gives you 360 degrees of authentic trading and sea combat simulation together with a mariner's pursuit of vengeance: Only by succeeding on the treacherous High Seas can your rank and status steadily improve - along with the wealth of your home estate - until you reclaim the title stripped from your forebears long ago!

FEATURES

> Variety of goods to trade and passengers to carry.
> Command a crew of soldiers, sailors and apprentices.
> Defend against pirates and enemy men-o'-war.
> Buy and enhance ships from several types.
> Highly intuitive interface.
> Dynamic pricing and political models.
> Strong re-playability.
> Extensive speech with professional voices (CD-ROM only).

84091.name: Machiavelli the Prince
84091.description:
From the back of the passage:

Niccolo Machiavelli stunned the world with his brutal analysis of power politics in government and religion. Now you can use those same devious strategies to conquer your rivals in this addictive simulation of 14th century political life.

Machiavelli the Prince allows you to rule the world and acquire vast wealth and power. You will trade exotic goods with over 40 cities. You will manipulate political and religious institutions using bribery, slander and assassination. You will field mercenary armies capable of crushing your enemy on medieval battlefields. And you will experience it all through brand-new super VGA graphics.

Play on a historical map or in a randomly generated world. Compete against the sophisticated artificial intelligence of computer players, or with up to three human players via modem. In Machiavelli the Prince winning is a matter of strength, shrewdness and clever deception.

84092.name: Fantasy Zone II: The Tears of Opa-Opa
84092.description:
Fantasy Zone II: The Tears of Opa-Opa (ファンタジーゾーンII オパオパの涙) is a Sega Master System game created by Sega in 1987. Like in the first Fantasy Zone, the player controls a sentient spaceship named Opa-opa who fights surreal invader enemies. Like its predecessor, Fantasy Zone II departs from the traditional scrolling shooter themes with its bright colors and whimsical designs. For this reason, it is occasionally dubbed a "cute 'em up".

Source: Wikipedia, "Fantasy Zone II: The Tears of Opa-Opa", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84093.name: G.M. Magazine (Issue 3- Nov 1988)
rpgissue: G.M. - The Independent Fantasy Roleplaying Magazine
84093.description:
Contents:

•News
•Paint Shop special by Fraser Gray
•Reviews - Night of the Ninja, Ninja and superspies, The original Bruce Lee, Lost Worlds, Cyborg Commando, Dragonlance, Spiral Arm 2
•Life Support - Ingrid's back, legend of the sword
•PBM Update
•David Gemmell Interview by Alan Crump & Wayne
•'Zine Scene
•Battletech Poster
•Neuromancer
•CityTech Rules supplement
•Dungeon Master Players Guide Part 2 by David Bishop
•Summary Judgement - short story by JOn Sutherland & Nigel Gross
•Multi User Games
•Live Roleplaying
•Last Chance for Darkness - GM's latest scenario
•Land Raiders Competition
•Chris Achilleos Interview
•The Axeman Cometh!

84094.name: What Did I Do To Deserve This, My Lord!?
84094.description:
Using a limited number of "steps" and a pickaxe, the player must dig and create a maze with monsters in it to defend the demon lord from heroes. More steps are given when a stage is cleared, based on how well the player did. The "steps" have another function, however, they are also used to add levels to monsters. At first, the player must dig and create the maze while creating monsters before a hero comes to capture the demon lord. When the hero appears and is going to enter the maze, the player must take the demon lord and change his location, preferably making him harder for the hero to find. When the hero gets into the maze, he will take random paths (if there are more than one) until he finds and captures the demon lord. The hero will fight against any monster that gets in his way.

When the hero captures the demon lord, he will go back by the same path taking the demon lord with him. It is possible to create monsters to save the demon lord during this.

The ground changes depending on the slimes that the player 'releases' from the blocks. If the block is covered with moss, and the player uses his pickaxe on this block, a slime will be released. These slimes move around the dungeon, absorbing, and expelling the material from the rocks, creating blocks with more and more material. Once a block obtains enough material, it will change colors depending on just how much is in the block. Stronger, more powerful monsters will be released if the block has more material. The death of monsters or heroes, along with some of the heroes' actions, has varied effects on the surrounding ground. For example, if a hero casts a spell, the surrounding blocks will be filled with mana. More so, if that hero dies, the remainder of his mana is expelled onto all surrounding blocks.

Source: Wikipedia, "What Did I Do To Deserve This, My Lord?," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

84095.name: Playouts: Small Keep
84095.description:
From publisher blurb:

Playouts are layouts to be printed and used at the game table during play. In this PDF, you will find a small keep. It is four stories high with a sub-level that includes storage space and cells for prisoners or beasts. Consider the staircases somewhat fudged for use with a five-foot equals one inch grid. One could claim this keep has a garrison from one dozen to three dozen guards, if one considers the beds as bunk beds and assumes that those on duty give up their beds to those who are not. The artillery is somewhat downsized from the great siege machines and meant to be akin to spear-throwers. The final two pages include a blank background and Playouts bits in case you wish to add to the keep, change a few things around, or build something of your own in the same style. This small keep is perfect as a roadside toll collector, a starter-stronghold for up and coming PCs or even as a wizard’s tower of sorts. A GM could also claim it has long since been abandoned by civilized folks and now must be scourged of evil creatures.

84096.name: Superstitions
84096.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can you steer your ship by the albatross? Do you dare to wear the Boar's Tusks of Goblinoid Slaying? Will casting the Shark's Feeding Frenzy on your companions save their skins?

This new 32 page pdf takes many real world superstitions and gives you tips on how to use them in your game. Nearly one hundred Magic Items, Spells, and Advanced Creatures are included.

84097.name: Background, Contacts, Honor, and Reputation
84097.description:
From Introduction:

This handy supplement includes a miscellany of variant rules and subsystems that affect the way a campaign works. These variants don’t change individual characters or tactics, but instead represent additional aspects of either or both non-player and player characters (such as the rules for honor) or how the game handles certain pre-game elements (such as the section on backgrounds).

84098.name: Horror: Cults and Conspiracies
84098.description:
From Introduction:

Paranoia is one of the keystones of horror. They really are all out to get you. Any smiling face could be a waxen mask concealing a horrible mess of slimy tentacles, or warp into the fanged maw of a werewolf, or be perfectly human but still betray you to the darkness. There are unknown armies moving in the shadows, cults and conspiracies that serve dark goals or dark masters. There are also groups who hunt the darkness, who oppose these cults – or who are cults themselves.

84099.name: Weather
84099.description:
From Introduction:

For the purposes of these rules, weather consists of three basic ingredients: temperature, wind, and precipitation. Each of these categories is presented as a hazard. To create a weather condition, just pick a hazard for each and combine their effects. The hazards are designed so that they do not conflict. You can match any temperature effect with any wind effect, and the two function independently of each other.

In some cases, you can select more than one hazard for a type. Precipitation covers fog in addition to hail and rain. In addition, you could create a storm that delivers both rain and hail. The sample storms given below serve as a guide to illustrate how you can combine these effects. Common sense serves as your best guide in putting together storms and effects. In addition, the section on long-term weather provides ideas and guidelines for creating sensible weather patterns for an area.

Note that in some cases the weather traits draw on material presented in the core rules. While the basic rules remain the same, they have been adapted to fit into the design and classification scheme presented here.

84100.name: A Simple Lair
84100.description:
From Introduction:

PC’s, on the whole, can be an unpredictable lot, suddenly going off in completely the opposite direction to that which you (the DM) had planned, or insisting on visiting a possible adventure area that appears on their campaign map - but which you have not designed yet. This is where a ‘side-track’ adventure may be able to help. The basic idea behind these ‘mini-adventure’ supplements is that, while they can be used a small adventures on their own, they can also be ‘inserted’ into an existing adventure or campaign as an extra area for your players to explore.

Each ‘side-track’ adventure therefore concentrates solely on the ‘dungeon’ aspect of the encounter(s), and contains full colour floor-plans for use with your 25-30mm miniatures (if you so desire). Even if you don’t use miniatures, using the floorplans to show the layout of the dungeon is a great time saver (rather than having to quote the exact room dimensions for the party’s mapper all the time).
